The original name of the estate comes from the coat of arms of the Puymorin family, which dates back to the 12th century: Gold for breadth, richness and the typicality of the southern Rhône, and Red (gules in heraldry) for character, power and elegance. They reflect the personality of the wines. The owners are deeply attached to the respect of a job well done, to the ancestral know-how, they are winegrowers in love with their job. This southern Rhône estate is turned towards the future with a crucial role for women, cutting-edge technological choices and an unfailing attachment to respect for the environment.Three convictions are anchored in the DNA of the estate:- to produce original wines "rich in personality" of great quality- to respect and protect our environment- to create the conditions for the blossoming of the men who work on the estateIn addition to the exceptional quality of the soils due to their richness in pebbles, the estate benefits from a lightly sloped exposure to the South and South-East. Come and discover the wines and much more, from Monday to Saturday: from 10 am to 7 pm in spring and summer, from 10 am to 6 pm in autumn and winter.The cellar of the Château d'Or et de Gueules is a permanent exhibition gallery of regional painters.Group services by appointmentPrivate tasting, visit of the cellar, personalized reception of your customers.Reception rooms, congress or seminar from 30 to 150 persons seated.Possibility of catering.Parking 3 buses.Do not hesitate to contact the estate for a personalized service.

hasBeenPublishedBy.schema:logo: https://www.tourismegard.com/Portals/2/Market-place/Le portail des pros du tourisme du Gard_fichiers/logo-Gard-Tourisme.jpg

en:
A family wine estate, Diane de Puymorin, Mathieu Chatain and their daughters run it and live there.
The original name of the estate comes from the Puymorin family coat of arms, which dates from the 12th century
Gold for breadth, richness and the typicality of the southern Rhône, and Red (gules in heraldry) for character, power and elegance.
The colours, Gold and Red, are much more than a simple "marketing" choice. They reflect the personality of the wines
The owners have a deep attachment to the respect of a job well done, to the ancestral know-how, they are winegrowers in love with their job. This estate in the southern Rhone region looks to the future with a crucial role for women, cutting-edge technological choices and an unfailing commitment to respecting the environment.
Three convictions are anchored in the DNA of the Domaine:
- to produce original wines "rich in personality" of great quality
- to respect and protect our environment
- to create the conditions for the development of the people who work on the estate
In addition to the exceptional quality of the soils due to their richness in pebbles, the estate benefits from a lightly sloping exposure facing South and South-East. The proximity of the main ponds of the Petite Camargue gives it a cooler night, which is undoubtedly reflected in the wines produced.
Come and discover the wines and much more, from Monday to Saturday: from 10 am to 7 pm in spring and summer, from 10 am to 6 pm in autumn and winter
All the wines of the Domaine can be tasted.
The cellar also offers a selection of old vintages of our cuvées de Garde for sale.
The cellar of the Château d'Or et de Gueules is a permanent exhibition gallery of regional painters.
Group services by appointment
Private tasting, visit of the cellar, personalized reception of your customers.
Reception, conference or seminar rooms for 30 to 150 people seated.
Possibility of catering.
Parking for 3 buses.
Do not hesitate to contact the estate for a personalized service.
fr:
Une propriété viticole familiale, Diane de Puymorin, Mathieu Chatain et leurs filles l’exploitent et y habitent.
Le nom original du Domaine vient du blason de la famille Puymorin, qui date du XIIe siècle. 
L’Or pour l’ampleur, la richesse et la typicité du Rhône méridional, et le Rouge (gueules en héraldique) pour le caractère, la puissance et l’élégance.
Les couleurs, Or et Rouge, sont bien plus qu'un simple choix "marketing". C'est le reflet de la personnalité des vins. 
Les propriétaires ont un profond attachement au respect du travail bien fait, au savoir-faire ancestral, ce sont des vignerons amoureux de leur métier. Ce domaine du sud du Rhône est tourné vers le futur avec un rôle crucial des femmes, des choix technologiques de pointe, un attachement sans faille au respect de l’environnement.
Trois convictions sont ancrées dans l'ADN du Domaine :
- produire des vins originaux "riches de personnalité" de grande qualité
- respecter et protéger notre environnement
- créer les conditions d'épanouissement des hommes qui travaillent au domaine
Outre la qualité exceptionnelle des sols par sa richesse en galets, le domaine bénéficie d’une exposition en légers coteaux orientée Sud, Sud-est. La proximité avec les principaux étangs de la petite Camargue lui octroie une plus grande fraîcheur des nuits, qui se retrouve incontestablement dans les vins produits.
Venez découvrir les vins et bien plus, du lundi au samedi : de 10 h 00 à 19 h 00 au printemps et en été, de 10 h 00 à 18 h 00 en automne et en hiver
L'ensemble des vins du Domaine pourra être dégusté.
Le caveau vous propose également à la vente une sélection de vieux millésimes sur nos cuvées de Garde.
Le caveau du Château d'Or et de Gueules est une galerie permanente d'exposition de peintres régionaux.
Prestations de groupe sur rendez-vous
Dégustation privée, visite de la cave, réception personnalisée de vos clients..
Salles de réception, congrès ou séminaire de 30 à 150 personnes assises.
Possibilité de traiteur.
Parking 3 bus.
N'hésitez pas à contacter le domaine pour une prestation personnalisée.
